pageContext.description: A hollow about 3.5 mm deep. between loop stumps. Slightly cut along left side. (possibly from analysis) golden bronze shows.
pageContext.surface: heavily pocked. Brown soil adheres on septum & in hollows below stop.
pageContext.other: 3 cross section drawings of palstave on reverse, Palstave is damaged and corroded., Edge chipped and blunted, Flange wing decayed more on one side, Hollow appears to be on septum into stop ridge., Midrib running below stop, possibly side ridges below stop., Associations - At least one other palstave Exeter Museum 65/1924/1 is associated with this location, but not recognized on this card.
pageContext.collection: 65/1924/2., Given to: Canada Manitoba Winnipeg Museum H3 1-1
pageContext.site: England,  devonshire, [christow] parish of bridford, nr. bridford., scatter rock quarry, oct. 1924, sx 821856
